intro: Centaurea atakorensis, commonly known as the Atakorensis thistle, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny leaves and produces bright yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical structure reflects evolutionary adaptations to its native habitat.
